poem:
### At the Edge of a Fork

The metal talks,  
a clang of policy,  
each cusp of road  
a choice of echo.

Britain stands,  
an island on its toes,  
neither tarred nor charmed,  
its fate not yet  
inked by the bold  
cut of trade's  
relentless scissors.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Guardian view on US-Europe relations: Britain is coming to a fork in the road | Editorial No country can avoid the economic impact of Donald Trump’s aggressive trade policy. There are no exceptions to the president’s global tariff on aluminium and steel and no escaping the general volatility and constant uncertainty provoked by a capricious regime. But Britain is lucky not to be a direct target. Mr Trump has no border-related grievance against the UK,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
